England finished top and Slovenia also advanced to the knockout stages of Euro 2024 after an uninspiring 0-0 draw in their final Group C match on Tuesday.
Slovenia secured their passage to the last 16 with the draw.
England and Slovenia played to a 0-0 draw in their Euro 2024 Group C match.
Bukayo Saka had a goal disallowed in the first half due to Phil Foden being offside.
Kobbie Mainoo and Cole Palmer made positive impacts as substitutes for England.
Phil Foden and Bukayo Saka showed moments of quality but were unable to break the deadlock.
Kobbie Mainoo was introduced at halftime, replacing Conor Gallagher, and brought more speed to England's passing.
John Stones had a header cleared from in front of the post, and Bukayo Saka missed an overhead kick attempt.
Cole Palmer had a good chance in added time but shot too close to the goalkeeper.
Phil Foden's movement was the most incisive among England's forward players.
England dominated possession and territory but failed to create significant scoring opportunities.
Slovenia's goalkeeper, Jan Oblak, was not seriously tested throughout the match.
Trent Alexander-Arnold (England) missed a right footed shot from outside the box in the 90'+4' minute.
